definition: to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
(negative prefix)/not/no
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
joyous/happy/pleased
variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
hubbub/clamor/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]

sentences.english: Negotiations frequently turn ugly, with channels going dark as discussions fail.
sentences.chinese: 谈判常常不欢而散，致使频道停播。

sentences.english: After a few days, of ready to do sth we try again, still be to part on bad terms.
sentences.chinese: 几天后，蠢蠢欲动的我们再次尝试，依然是不欢而散。

sentences.english: But this was against the union, the negotiations finally broke up.
sentences.chinese: 但这遭到工会的反对，谈判最终不欢而散。

sentences.english: The results also made up a new round of 50-year-old huff, two people.
sentences.chinese: 结果又惹起新一轮的争持，两人不欢而散。

sentences.english: She apologize to Lin Lin, the result is in discord.
sentences.chinese: 罗梅到琳琳家道歉，结果还是不欢而散。

to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to quarrel/dispute
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
the conversation is disagreeable (idiom)
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
can't come to an agreement
disagreeable/unpleasant
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
to become reconciled/to bury the hatchet
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
